title: Eric Gill's John Hogg Alphabet
content:
Has anyone digitized Eric Gill's lettercut in Hoptonwood stone published by John Hogg in 1925?

I am looking for Roman Capitals similar to this work. I do not wish to use the common Trajan font but something a little more obscure.

Any suggestions?
author: HuntedCity

comments.content: Do you have a sample image?

what about peter bruhn's eric sans?

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fountain/eric-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018053205/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fountain/eric-sans/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fountain/eric-sans/")

The caps from Monotype's Gill Facia display font might be close to what you're looking for, although I think they lack the grace of Gill's better stonecutting.

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/gill-facia-mt/regular-display/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018053205/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/gill-facia-mt/regular-display/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/gill-facia-mt/regular-display/")

Ignore the lowercase.
